definition: to put (a criminal) to death/to punish
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: Two people make to avoid kill of king of the Qin Dynasty to kill, a strange combination of circumstances rushed into Lu city.
sentences.chinese: 兩人爲了躲避秦王誅殺令，陰差陽錯闖進了潞邑。

sentences.english: Killing the common people at will is the behavior of a tyrant.
sentences.chinese: 隨意誅殺百姓是暴君的行徑。

definition: to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to be in overall charge/to oversee
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle

Lü Buwei (?291-235 BC), merchant and politician of the State of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], subsequent Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor, allegedly the father of Ying Zheng 嬴政[Ying2 Zheng4], who subsequently became the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
